snippet: A fatal confrontation reveals the tensions between two of the mayor’s priorities: mending relations between the police and minority residents while fighting serious crime by focusing on petty offenses.
abstract: Death of Eric Garner on Staten Island after confrontation with New York City police throws into sharp relief tension between two pillars of de Blasio administration's law enforcement agenda; strong focus of administration is on mending frayed relations between police and residents of black and Latino neighborhoods while holding down serious crime by aggressively attacking minor offenses.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and VIVIAN YEE
byline.contributor: Annie Correal, Benjamin Mueller and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A fatal confrontation reveals the tensions between two of the mayor’s priorities: mending relations between the police and minority residents while fighting serious crime by focusing on petty offenses.

headline.main: Death of a Man in Custody Adds Fuel to a Dispute Over a Policing Strategy
headline.print_headline: Death of a Man in Custody Adds Fuel to a Dispute Over a Policing Strategy
